Comments_List: The lab was useful as a time for NROTC meet as singular unit, and practice movements, learn about military finances, and especially do group activities like small arms training/leadership courses.
Military knowledge necessary to be an officer in the fleet

Strengths:  Interesting group activities : leadership reaction course, good speakers to learn about other aspects within the armed forces once commissioned.

Weaknesses:  Terrible time slot - many other classes meet at Friday 1230-230.  Military GMTs have been done too many times, and waste time that could be spend on more productive ventures.  Lack of midshipmen engagement due to not respecting others' time.
We just had to do it. The material can be boring at times, but it is necessary and important

I hate GMTs, but I understand that we need to do them. I do appreciate, however, that the staff are able to plan certain trips (for CAC cards, for example) during lab so that we do not need to give up any additional time (beyond what we already do for weekly NROTC activities).
Only take this if in Navy ROTC, or are looking to join the unit/see what weekly midshipmen life is like.
Its required for midshipmen, so I would recommend this course to those interested in NROTC
Obviously only if you are in NROTC lol. It would be pretty weird if anyone else showed up
